results.title: HMAS Stalwart
results.brief_description: The destroyer tender HMAS Stalwart is the largest naval vessel yet built in Australia. Designed to provide maintenance facilities, the ship has a well equipped workshop for repairs usually done ashore.

results.title: Hjorundfjord
results.brief_description: Shows the life and tourist activities in the fjord. Scenes show the harvest on land and salmon fishing from motor boats. Commercial salmon fishing has been the activity of some families for generations. A wedding couple crosses the fjord in a boat to the strains of the Hardanger eight-stringed fiddle and tourists are seen hiking, boating and mountain climbing around the fjord.

results.title: Hitting a brick wall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
For some retirement is an unexpected shock. How can one properly prepare? It’s easy if you have the right ideas and think about it early enough

results.title: Hitler: the road to revenge
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Shows how Hitler’s personality, and the social, political and economic conditions in the 1930’s, played a large role in his rise to power. Also indicates the means by which he achieved power: mass psychology, propaganda and physical violence. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Hitler: the final chapter
results.creator_credit: Cyril Jones and Cyril Jones and Associates
results.brief_description: One of the most discussed questions in history, “what really happened to Hitler?” is the subject of this investigative documentary, written and produced by Cyril Jones. He uses footage obtained from the Russian Film Archives to support his case as well as the testimony of Elena Rjeveskaia, last surviving member of the SMERSH team. The documentary also covers the fate of Hitler’s chosen successor, Dr Joseph Goebbels, and his family.

results.title: Hitler: revenge to ruin
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: This film documents those events during World War II that gradually led to Hitler’s fall from power and eventual suicide inthe face of defeat. Shows Hitler at the apex of his power in 1940. With the defeat of France, Hitler was not content to stop his drive for control of Europe. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Hitler: anatomy of a dicatatorship
results.brief_description: Adolph Hitler became legal head of the German government in 1933. To a nation torn by economic, political and spiritual crises, he promised strong leadership and a policy of revenge against supposed enemies, at home and abroad. With little opposition, Hitler soon made himself the master of Europe. Before the Allies finally defeated him, he would be responsible for the deaths of over 350 million people, an unmatched record of dictatorial brutality. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hitler: a film from Germany = Hitler, Ein Film Aus Deutschland
results.creator_credit: Hans Syberberg, BBC, I N A, EDR, Solaris Film and TMS Film GmbH
results.brief_description: In confronting Nazism Syberberg was not interested in the conventions of realism. In Syberberg’s view, ‘one doesn’t fight Hitler with the statistics of Auschwitz and the sociology of his economic system, but with Richard Wagner and Mozart’. In a series of surrealist tableaux in a variety of dramatic modes - fairytale, circus, morality play, allegorical pageant, magic ceremony, philosophical dialogue - in four parts, Syberberg seeks to embrace, in the words of John Sandford, ‘the mythic totality of Hitler’s world (‘pathos’) and the confrontation of the mythic with reality (‘irony’), the sublime with the ridiculous’. For Susan Sontag ‘it is a ghostly film haunted by (Syberberg’s) great cinematic models (Melies, Eisenstein) and antimodels (Riefenstahl, Hollywood), by German Romanticism (and) above all by Wagner and his music’. Contents: Der gral The grail (96 min.)—A German dream Ein Deutscher Traun (126 min.)—The end of a winter’s tale and the final victory of progress Das ende eines wintermarchens (93 min.)—We children of hell remember the European age Wir kinder der holle (100 min.) Also includes the book ‘Syberberg, A filmmaker from Germany’. In German and English with English subtitles.

constellations_other.name: Undercutting extremism with absurdity
constellations_other.description: Taika Waititi's satirical performance as Adolf Hitler in Jojo Rabbit connects to a number of other portrayals that includes ill-fated (and conceived) TV shows, memes, high camp and cinema classics.
